markers.marker: HK416 sees Akko (during character selection), and mistakes her for G28.
HK416 asks Akko for her name.
HK416 freaks out when she sees Akko screw up her transformation.
HK416 realizes that Akko doesn't just look like G28: she acts like her, too.
HK416 is impressed by Akko's first transformation, and notes that it must take some practice to be able to do it impromptu like Akko does.
HK416 asks Chazz what his arm-thing is. She also insults his hair and intelligence.
HK416 immediately notices Hanako's shyness and hesitation, and calls her out on it.
HK416 notes Hanako's resemblance to M4A1 (pre-MOD3).
If HK416 has all of her layers on, she'll call PA-15's first loss a careless mistake.
HK416 admits she's at a significant disadvantage, being down to 2 or less layers while PA-15 is stripping her first layer.
HK416 comments on PA-15's ability to improvise her way out of a jam having failed her.
HK416 introduces herself (on the character selection screen) in PA-15's presence.
HK416 is angry after losing her final hand.
A forfeitting HK416 wishes that she had more to look at, while PA-15 strips her first layer.
If PA-15 loses after HK416, the latter will note that the mutual loss is enjoyable, in its own way.
HK416 will settle for no less than victory, especially with another T-Doll at the table.
HK416 claims that Dolls like PA-15 don't care about anything and have poor planning skills.
HK416 claims partial victory over PA-15. And totally doesn't think that PA-15 is hot, totally not~
HK416 attributes her minor victory over PA-15 to 'patience and planning'. (Yes, in a game based on luck.)
HK416 refuses to give PA-15 the satisfaction of betraying her professionalism.
If HK416 has somehow managed to completely lose by the time PA-15 strips her first layer, she'll just stay completely silent and refuse to give her the satisfaction of showing her anger.
HK416 admits that PA-15 is actually pretty hot.
If PA-15 loses the first round of the game, HK416 will ask if she's even trying.
Rin reminds HK416 of a certain someone (G11).
HK416 asks Rin why she wears a tie. Wouldn't it get in the way?
HK416 asks Rin why she's at the Inventory.
HK416 gets immediately annoyed by Saki's shyness, and it out.
HK416 apologizes, and notes her similarity to pre-MOD3 M4A1... and also gets the feeling that bad things will happen if Saki's left alone.
Spurred on by memories of her sister, HK416 decides to maybe order a drink. Even now, she still can't make up her mind.
HK416 won't be having anything to drink, since the last time she did things got a bit... crazy.
Which Sei is HK416 talking to? The T-Doll, or the human?
